column1: \ This is a template for your own plain-text reading log.
\ This file can be parsed by the Reading gem
column2: so that you can display the data on a webpage.

column1: \ The examples below are taken from the CSV format guide:
\ Any line in this file starting with a backslash (\) is a comment and will be ignored by the Reading parser.
\ Feel free to delete these explanatory comments.
\ You can edit this file in any spreadsheet app or text editor.

column2: be sure to select the pipe character (|) as the column separator.

column1: \ I highly recommend the Rainbow CSV extension for VS Code: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mechatroner.rainbow-csv
\ Be sure to set VS Code's Language Mode to "CSV (pipe)".
\ Entering a row is much less cumbersome if you set up a keyboard shortcut that pastes a row template.
\ I myself use an AutoHotkey script: https://github.com/fpsvogel/reading/blob/main/doc/autohotkey-reading-csv.ahk
Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
Tom Holt - Goatsong: A Novel of Ancient Athens -- The Walled Orchard
|🔊Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind|Vail Library B00ICN066A|2021/09/20||history
column3: with special attention paid to human happiness. -- Ch. 5: "We did not domesticate wheat. It domesticated us." -- End of ch. 8: the ubiquity of patriarchal societies is so far unexplained. It would make more sense for women (being on average more socially adept) to have formed a matriarchal society as among the bonobos. -- Ch. 19: are we happier in modernity? It's doubtful.
